title: NASA’s Artemis 2 rocket hit by new problem expected to bump moonshot into early April
summary: Engineers ran into problems repressurizing the Artemis 2 moon rocket’s upper stage helium tanks overnight Friday, a problem that will require rolling the huge rocket off the launch pad and back to its processing hangar for troubleshooting. The work will push the already delayed mission from March to at least early April, officials said Saturday.

title: NASA preparing for Artemis 2 rollback to fix upper stage problem
summary:
Just 24 hours after setting a March 6 launch date for the Artemis 2 mission, NASA said a problem with the Space Launch System upper stage could delay the launch.
The post NASA preparing for Artemis 2 rollback to fix upper stage problem appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Artemis II Likely Delayed Due to Upper Stage Problem

title: Bruno says he joined Blue Origin to work on ‘urgent’ national security projects
summary:
Tory Bruno, former CEO of United Launch Alliance, said he decided to join Blue Origin to work on important national security projects, including applications of the company’s Blue Ring spacecraft.
The post Bruno says he joined Blue Origin to work on ‘urgent’ national security projects appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: Falcon 9 to launch 25 Starlink satellites after weather delays
summary: SpaceX is counting down to the launch of a Falcon 9 rocket carrying 25 Starlink satellites from California, after days of delay. Liftoff from Space Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 1 a.m. PST (4 a.m. EST / 0900 UTC).

title: Aalto plots Australia base to boost planned high-altitude pseudo satellite service
summary:
Aalto is turning to Australia as a key operating base to bolster the business case for initial commercial services of its stratospheric pseudo-satellite over Japan, now pushed to 2027 amid regulatory hurdles and ongoing system-integration work.
The post Aalto plots Australia base to boost planned high-altitude pseudo satellite service appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Is Helping Bring Giant Tortoises Back to the Galápagos
summary: Giant tortoises are returning to Floreana Island after more than 150 years, guided by NASA data that shows suitable areas for release.

title: NASA Confirms March 6 as Target Date for Astronaut Moon Mission

title: NASA targeting March 6 for Artemis 2 launch
summary:
NASA is targeting a March 6 launch for Artemis 2 after completing a countdown test with few problems.
